page.title: 12TRANSPORT AND ROADS.
page.content: Our area is residential,but there are three main roads. {The A456 Halesowen by-pass}stretches 1.5 miles between the Bromsgrove and Hayley Green islands.In 1962 a second lane was added to the carriageway.It's an urban clearway and is part of the Birmingham link to the Clent Hills and Kidderminster. {The B4183 Hagley Road}streches through Halesowen into Hasbury.Passenger buses take people to places like Stourbridge, Cradley Heath and Dudley. During the day 1000 vehicles pass per hour down the Hagley road. {There are far more cars than other {vehicles on the by-pass.}The main road is busy and dangerous,but side roads are fairly quiet and safe.Fortunately there are not many main roads in this area.
